name: Leeching Bite
text: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn. Another target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: A substantial portion of Vorinclex's forces became fuel for the rest.

name: Leeching Licid
text:
{B}, {T}: Leeching Licid loses this ability and becomes an Aura enchantment with enchant creature. Attach it to target creature. You may pay {B} to end this effect.
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, Leeching Licid deals 1 damage to that player.

name: Leeching Sliver
text: Whenever a Sliver you control attacks, defending player loses 1 life.

editions.flavor:
"Seeing one slowly devour one of my party begged the question—do they know what cruelty is?"
—Hastric, Thunian scout

name: Leechridden Swamp
text:
({T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.)
Leechridden Swamp enters the battlefield tapped.
{B}, {T}: Each opponent loses 1 life. Activate this ability only if you control two or more black permanents.

editions.set: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis

name: Leering Emblem
text:
Whenever you cast a spell, equipped creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
Equip {2}

editions.flavor: The banner was not a symbol of victory, but a herald of the carnage to come.

name: Leering Gargoyle
text:
Flying
{T}: Leering Gargoyle gets -2/+2 and loses flying until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Only a gargoyle would take such delight in a thunderstorm."
—Qhattib, Vizier of Amiqat

name: Leery Fogbeast
text: Whenever Leery Fogbeast becomes blocked, prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.

editions.flavor: It emerges from the mists only to feed.

name: Legacy's Allure
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a treasure counter on Legacy's Allure.
Sacrifice Legacy's Allure: Gain control of target creature with power less than or equal to the number of treasure counters on Legacy's Allure. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

name: Legacy Weapon
text:
{W}{U}{B}{R}{G}: Exile target permanent.
If Legacy Weapon would be put into a graveyard from anywhere, reveal Legacy Weapon and shuffle it into its owner's library instead.

name: Legerdemain
text: Exchange control of target artifact or creature and another target permanent that shares one of those types with it. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

editions.flavor: Squee tucked the warm ball in his pocket and slipped a pebble in its place. "Glok," he mumbled, and hid.
Squee tucked the warm ball in his pocket and slipped a pebble in its place. ‘Glok,' he mumbled, and hid.

name: Legion Loyalist
text:
Haste
Battalion — Whenever Legion Loyalist and at least two other creatures attack, creatures you control gain first strike and trample until end of turn and can't be blocked by creature tokens this turn.

name: Legion's Initiative
text:
Red creatures you control get +1/+0.
White creatures you control get +0/+1.
{R}{W}, Exile Legion's Initiative: Exile all creatures you control. At the beginning of the next combat, return those cards to the battlefield under their owner's control and those creatures gain haste until end of turn.

name: Legions of Lim-Dûl
text: Snow swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a snow Swamp.)

editions.flavor:
"I have seen the faces of my dead friends among that grim band, and I can bear no more."
—Lucilde Fiksdotter, Leader of the Order of the White Shield.

"I have seen the faces of my dead friends among that grim band, and I can bear no more."
—Lucilde Fiksdotter, Leader of the Order of the White Shield.

name: Lens of Clarity
text: You may look at the top card of your library and at face-down creatures you don't control. (You may do this at any time.)

editions.flavor:
"Water shifts and confuses, but as ice it holds the stillness of truth."
—Arel the Whisperer

name: Leonin Abunas
text: Artifacts you control have hexproof. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

editions.flavor: Only leonin clerics who can survive the Razor Fields for one turning of the suns can stand in the Cave of Light.
Only leonin clerics who can survive the Razor Fields for one turning of the suns can stand in the Cave of Light.

name: Leonin Arbiter
text: Players can't search libraries. Any player may pay {2} for that player to ignore this effect until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "Our people are torn by infighting. Until the two sides reconcile, our laws can carry no meaning."

name: Leonin Armorguard
text: When Leonin Armorguard enters the battlefield, creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Well suited are the nacatl to a coat of steel and forge-tempered claws.

name: Leonin Battlemage
text:
{T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
Whenever you cast a spell, you may untap Leonin Battlemage.

editions.flavor: The strongest of the pride are measured not by the steel in their hands but by the steel in their souls.

name: Leonin Bladetrap
text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
{2}, Sacrifice Leonin Bladetrap: Leonin Bladetrap deals 2 damage to each attacking creature without flying.

name: Leonin Bola
text:
Equipped creature has "{T}, Unattach Leonin Bola: Tap target creature."
Equip {1} ({1}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery. This card enters the battlefield unattached and stays on the battlefield if the creature leaves.)

name: Leonin Den-Guard
text: As long as Leonin Den-Guard is equipped, it gets +1/+1 and has vigilance.

editions.flavor: No one under the four suns can elude the watchful eye of the den-guard.

name: Leonin Elder
text: Whenever an artifact enters the battlefield, you may gain 1 life.

editions.flavor:
"The wisdom of the elders is just as much a weapon as a sword or spear. We must learn to wield it."
—Ushanti, leonin seer

name: Leonin Iconoclast
text: Heroic — Whenever you cast a spell that targets Leonin Iconoclast, destroy target enchantment creature an opponent controls.

editions.flavor: "The stars belong in the night sky. This is our world, and we are our own masters."

name: Leonin Relic-Warder
text:
When Leonin Relic-Warder enters the battlefield, you may exile target artifact or enchantment.
When Leonin Relic-Warder leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control.

name: Leonin Scimitar
text:
Equipped creature gets +1/+1.
Equip {1} ({1}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

editions.flavor:
"Every scratch tells a story, and every notch has a name. Four generations have held this blade. You shall not disappoint them."
—Initiation of Laena, skyhunter

name: Leonin Shikari
text: You may activate equip abilities any time you could cast an instant.

editions.flavor: Her instinct is as sharp as her blade.

name: Leonin Skyhunter
text: Flying

editions.flavor: The skyhunters were born when the first leonin gazed at the heavens and wished to hunt the birds overhead.
"The infection has spread farther than we could glimpse from the heights of Taj-Nar."
The skyhunters were born when the first leonin gazed at the heavens and wished to hunt the birds overhead.
The skyhunters were born when the first leonin gazed at the heavens and wished to hunt the birds overhead.

name: Leonin Snarecaster
text: When Leonin Snarecaster enters the battlefield, you may tap target creature.

editions.flavor: Formerly oppressed by the polis of Meletis, leonin occasionally "mistake" their old enemies for game.
Formerly oppressed by the polis of Meletis, leonin occasionally "mistake" their old enemies for game.

name: Leonin Squire
text: When Leonin Squire enters the battlefield, return target artifact card with converted mana cost 1 or less from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor:
"I may be kha, but without my soldiers, my people, I am nothing."
—Raksha Golden Cub

name: Leonin Sun Standard
text: {1}{W}: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: The commander tells the troops where to go, but the standard reminds them why they're there.

name: Leovold, Emissary of Trest
text:
Each opponent can't draw more than one card each turn.
Whenever you or a permanent you control becomes the target of a spell or ability an opponent controls, you may draw a card.

editions.flavor: "I'm sure we can come to an arrangement."

name: Leovold's Operative
text:
Draft Leovold's Operative face up. 
As you draft a card, you may draft an additional card from that booster pack. If you do, turn Leovold's Operative face down, then pass the next booster pack without drafting a card from it. (You may look at that booster pack.)

name: Leshrac's Rite
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has swampwalk. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)

editions.flavor:
"Bind me to thee, my soul to thine. I am your servant and your slave. Blood for blood, flesh for flesh, Leshrac, my lord."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

"Bind me to thee, my soul to thine. I am your servant and your slave. Blood for blood, flesh for flesh, Leshrac, my lord."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

"Brackish water, dark and blind
Heed my will, to you I bind."
—Opening passage of Leshrac's Rite

"Bind me to thee, my soul to thine. I am your servant and your slave. I shall hunger for your word and thirst for your blessing. Blood for blood, flesh for flesh, Leshrac, my lord."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

name: Leshrac's Sigil
text:
Whenever an opponent casts a green spell, you may pay {B}{B}. If you do, look at that player's hand and choose a card from it. The player discards that card.
{B}{B}: Return Leshrac's Sigil to its owner's hand.

name: Lesser Gargadon
text: Whenever Lesser Gargadon attacks or blocks, sacrifice a land.

editions.flavor:
Trod on by a gargadon
—Kipamu expression meaning
"wiped out"

"In some cultures, elephants are ridden by those in power. I don't think a mere elephant would even be noticed in Keld."
—Onean sergeant

name: Lesser Werewolf
text: {B}: If Lesser Werewolf's power is 1 or more, it gets -1/-0 until end of turn and put a -0/-1 counter on target creature blocking or blocked by Lesser Werewolf. Activate this ability only during the declare blockers step.

name: Lethal Vapors
text:
Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, destroy it.
{0}: Destroy Lethal Vapors. You skip your next turn. Any player may activate this ability.

editions.flavor: The vapors infiltrate every crevice, poison every lung, and snuff out every life.

name: Lethargy Trap
text:
If three or more creatures are attacking, you may pay {U} rather than pay Lethargy Trap's mana cost.
Attacking creatures get -3/-0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Suddenly, Zurdi didn't care about treasure, glory, food . . . or the drakes circling above.

name: Lethe Lake
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put the top ten cards of your library into your graveyard.
Whenever you roll {CHAOS}, target player puts the top ten cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

name: Letter Bomb
text: When Letter Bomb comes into play, sign it and shuffle it into target player's library. That player reveals each card he or she draws until Letter Bomb is drawn. When that player draws Letter Bomb, it deals 19½ damage to him or her.

editions.flavor: "Dear Magic R&D, . . ."

name: Leveler
text: When Leveler enters the battlefield, exile all cards from your library.

editions.flavor: Once a century, the levelers rip through every corner of Mirrodin, obeying the commands of an unseen master.

name: Leviathan
text:
Trample
Leviathan enters the battlefield tapped and doesn't untap during your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may sacrifice two Islands. If you do, untap Leviathan.
Leviathan can't attack unless you sacrifice two Islands. (This cost is paid as attackers are declared.)

name: Levitation
text: Creatures you control have flying.

editions.flavor: Barrin's pride in his apprentice was diminished somewhat when he had to get the others back down.
Barrin's pride in his apprentice was diminished somewhat when he had to get the others back down.
"We'll be easy targets if we remain on the ground. Let's take the fight to them."
The horses of Scytha's army must be well trained. A thrown rider would fall miles before meeting the ground.
"Why fight over scraps of land when there's so much sky waiting to be claimed?"

name: Lexivore
text: If Lexivore damages any player, destroy target card in play, other than Lexivore, with the most lines of text in its text box. (If more than one card has the most lines of text, you choose which of those cards to destroy.)

editions.flavor:
Plucking the chicken
—Elvish expression meaning "flinging the monkey"

name: Ley Druid
text: {T}: Untap target land.

editions.flavor: After years of training, the druid becomes one with nature, drawing power from the land and returning it when needed.
After years of training, the Druid becomes one with nature, drawing power from the land and returning it when needed.
After years of training, the druid becomes one with nature, drawing power from the land and returning it when needed.
After years of training, the Druid becomes one with nature, drawing power from the land and returning it when needed.

After years of training, the Druid becomes one with nature, drawing power from the land and returning it when needed.
After years of training, the Druid becomes one with nature, drawing power from the land and returning it when needed.

name: Ley Line
text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player may put a +1/+1 counter on target creature of his or her choice.

editions.flavor:
"I can feel the strength of the entire forest."
—Gerrard

name: Leyline of Anticipation
text:
If Leyline of Anticipation is in your opening hand, you may begin the game with it on the battlefield.
You may cast spells as though they had flash. (You may cast them any time you could cast an instant.)

name: Leyline of Lifeforce
text:
If Leyline of Lifeforce is in your opening hand, you may begin the game with it on the battlefield.
Creature spells can't be countered.

editions.flavor: Where sovereignty and flesh converge.

name: Leyline of Lightning
text:
If Leyline of Lightning is in your opening hand, you may begin the game with it on the battlefield.
Whenever you cast a spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, Leyline of Lightning deals 1 damage to target player.

editions.flavor: Where storm and spellcraft converge.

name: Leyline of Punishment
text:
If Leyline of Punishment is in your opening hand, you may begin the game with it on the battlefield.
Players can't gain life.
Damage can't be prevented.

name: Leyline of Sanctity
text:
If Leyline of Sanctity is in your opening hand, you may begin the game with it on the battlefield.
You have hexproof. (You can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

name: Leyline of Singularity
text:
If Leyline of Singularity is in your opening hand, you may begin the game with it on the battlefield.
All nonland permanents are legendary.

editions.flavor: Where renown and solitude converge.

name: Leyline of the Meek
text:
If Leyline of the Meek is in your opening hand, you may begin the game with it on the battlefield.
Creature tokens get +1/+1.

editions.flavor: Where strength and humility converge.

name: Leyline of the Void
text:
If Leyline of the Void is in your opening hand, you may begin the game with it on the battlefield.
If a card would be put into an opponent's graveyard from anywhere, exile it instead.

editions.flavor: Where treachery and oblivion converge.

name: Leyline of Vitality
text:
If Leyline of Vitality is in your opening hand, you may begin the game with it on the battlefield.
Creatures you control get +0/+1.
Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, you may gain 1 life.

name: Leyline Phantom
text: When Leyline Phantom deals combat damage, return it to its owner's hand. (Return it only if it survived combat.)

editions.flavor:
"Is the maze itself a phantom? Or is one as real as the other? Perhaps I am as mad as the dragon."
—Jace Beleren, journal

"Is the maze itself a phantom? Or is one as real as the other? Perhaps I am as mad as the dragon."
—Jace Beleren, journal

name: Lhurgoyf
text: Lhurgoyf's power is equal to the number of creature cards in all graveyards and its toughness is equal to that number plus 1.

editions.flavor:
"Ach! Hans, run! It's the lhurgoyf!"
—Saffi Eriksdotter, last words

"Ach! Hans, run! It's the Lhurgoyf!"
—Saffi Eriksdotter, last words

"Ach! Hans, run! It's the lhurgoyf!"
—Saffi Eriksdotter, last words

"Ach! Hans, run! It's the Lhurgoyf!"
—Saffi Eriksdotter, last words

"Ach! Hans, run! It's the Lhurgoyf!"
—Saffi Eriksdotter, last words

"Ach! Hans, run! It's the Lhurgoyf!"
—Saffi Eriksdotter, last words

name: Liability
text: Whenever a nontoken permanent is put into a player's graveyard from the battlefield, that player loses 1 life.

editions.flavor: Gerrard realized that the helpless woman they'd rescued from Rath was nothing of the sort.

name: Liar's Pendulum
text: {2}, {T}: Name a card. Target opponent guesses whether a card with that name is in your hand. You may reveal your hand. If you do and your opponent guessed wrong, draw a card.

name: Liberate
text: Exile target creature you control. Return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.

editions.flavor:
"Not everyone gets a second chance."
—Hanna

name: Liberated Dwarf
text: {R}, Sacrifice Liberated Dwarf: Target green creature gets +1/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Freed from their chains, these dwarves are bound only by honor.

name: Liberating Combustion
text: Liberating Combustion deals 6 damage to target creature. You may search your library and/or graveyard for a card named Chandra, Pyrogenius, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you search your library this way, shuffle it.

name: Library of Alexandria
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{T}: Draw a card. Activate this ability only if you have exactly seven cards in hand.

name: Library of Lat-Nam
text:
An opponent chooses one —
• You draw three cards at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
• You search your library for a card, put that card into your hand, then shuffle your library.

name: Library of Leng
text:
You have no maximum hand size.
If an effect causes you to discard a card, discard it, but you may put it on top of your library instead of into your graveyard.

name: Lich
text:
As Lich enters the battlefield, you lose life equal to your life total.
You don't lose the game for having 0 or less life.
If you would gain life, draw that many cards instead.
Whenever you're dealt damage, sacrifice that many nontoken permanents. If you can't, you lose the game.
When Lich is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you lose the game.

name: Lichenthrope
text:
If damage would be dealt to Lichenthrope, put that many -1/-1 counters on it instead.
At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a -1/-1 counter from Lichenthrope.

name: Lich Lord of Unx
text:
{U}{B}, {T}: Create a 1/1 blue and black Zombie Wizard creature token.
{U}{U}{B}{B}: Target player loses X life and puts the top X cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard, where X is the number of Zombies you control.

name: Lich's Mirror
text: If you would lose the game, instead shuffle your hand, your graveyard, and all permanents you own into your library, then draw seven cards and your life total becomes 20.

editions.flavor: It shows not what you are but what you were.

name: Lich's Tomb
text:
You don't lose the game for having 0 or less life.
Whenever you lose life, sacrifice a permanent for each 1 life you lost. (Damage causes loss of life.)

name: Liege of the Axe
text:
Vigilance
Morph {1}{W} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
When Liege of the Axe is turned face up, untap it.

name: Liege of the Hollows
text: When Liege of the Hollows dies, each player may pay any amount of mana. Then each player who paid mana this way creates that many 1/1 green Squirrel creature tokens.

name: Liege of the Pit
text:
Flying, trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a creature other than Liege of the Pit. If you can't, Liege of the Pit deals 7 damage to you.
Morph {B}{B}{B}{B} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

name: Liege of the Tangle
text:
Trample
Whenever Liege of the Tangle deals combat damage to a player, you may choose any number of target lands you control and put an awakening counter on each of them. Each of those lands is an 8/8 green Elemental creature for as long as it has an awakening counter on it. They're still lands.

name: Lieutenant Kirtar
text:
Flying
{1}{W}, Sacrifice Lieutenant Kirtar: Exile target attacking creature.

editions.flavor:
"His strengths are pride, devotion, and ambition. His weaknesses are the same."
—Pianna, nomad captain

name: Lieutenants of the Guard
text: Council's dilemma — When Lieutenants of the Guard enters the battlefield, starting with you, each player votes for strength or numbers. Put a +1/+1 counter on Lieutenants of the Guard for each strength vote and create a 1/1 white Soldier creature token for each numbers vote.

name: Life
text: All lands you control become 1/1 creatures until end of turn. They're still lands.

editions.artist: Edward P. Beard, Jr. & Anthony S. Waters

name: Life and Limb
text: All Forests and all Saprolings are 1/1 green Saproling creatures and Forest lands in addition to their other types.

editions.flavor:
"It was a sight of pain and awe—a twisted forest, migrating across the salt plain in search of richer soil."
—Edahlis, greenseeker

name: Lifebane Zombie
text:
Intimidate (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)
When Lifebane Zombie enters the battlefield, target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a green or white creature card from it and exile that card.

name: Lifeblood
text: Whenever a Mountain an opponent controls becomes tapped, you gain 1 life.

editions.flavor: "Foolish wizard! As you tap the power of your lofty keep, so grows my strength." —Malvern Xelionos, Letters

name: Lifeblood Hydra
text:
Trample
Lifeblood Hydra enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it.
When Lifeblood Hydra dies, you gain life and draw cards equal to its power.

editions.flavor: Pharika has written her secrets on its bones so that only the worthy may discover them.

name: Life Burst
text: Target player gains 4 life, then gains 4 life for each card named Life Burst in each graveyard.

editions.flavor: As uplifting as a mystic's dreams.

name: Life Chisel
text: Sacrifice a creature: You gain life equal to the sacrificed creature's toughness. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

name: Lifecraft Awakening
text: Put X +1/+1 counters on target artifact you control. If it isn't a creature or Vehicle, it becomes a 0/0 Construct artifact creature.

editions.flavor: "It was made, yes, but that does not mean it cannot grow."

name: Lifecraft Cavalry
text:
Trample
Revolt — Lifecraft Cavalry enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it if a permanent you controlled left the battlefield this turn.

editions.flavor:
"I do not ask you to be tame. I only ask you to be true."
—Rishkar, Peema renegade

name: Lifecrafter's Bestiary
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, scry 1.
Whenever you cast a creature spell, you may pay {G}. If you do, draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"Inspiration is found by looking outward."
—Oviya Pashiri, sage lifecrafter

name: Lifecrafter's Gift
text: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature, then put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it.

editions.flavor: The best engineers recognize when a problem has already been solved.

name: Lifeforce
text: {G}{G}: Counter target black spell.

editions.flavor:
"Every fallen tree nourishes a thousand seedlings."
—Autumn Willow to Baron Sengir

name: Life from the Loam
text:
Return up to three target land cards from your graveyard to your hand.
Dredge 3 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly three cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

name: Lifegift
text: Whenever a land enters the battlefield, you may gain 1 life.

editions.flavor:
"Walk the world and you'll find your soul; search your soul and you'll discover the world."
—Diary of Azusa

name: Lifelace
text: Target spell or permanent becomes green. (Mana symbols on that permanent remain unchanged.)

name: Lifeline
text: Whenever a creature dies, if another creature is on the battlefield, return the first card to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.

name: Lifelink
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has lifelink. (Damage dealt by the creature also causes its controller to gain that much life.)

editions.flavor: The spoils of war are not measured only in gold and silver.
The spoils of war are not measured only in gold and silver.

name: Life Matrix
text: {4}, {T}: Put a matrix counter on target creature and that creature gains "Remove a matrix counter from this creature: Regenerate this creature." Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

name: Life's Finale
text: Destroy all creatures, then search target opponent's library for up to three creature cards and put them into his or her graveyard. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

editions.flavor: The feeble resistance of the flesh is over. Phyrexia spreads its shadow over all.

name: Life's Legacy
text:
As an additional cost to cast Life's Legacy, sacrifice a creature.
Draw cards equal to the sacrificed creature's power.

editions.flavor: At the instant of death, the mystery of life.

name: Lifesmith
text: Whenever you cast an artifact spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 3 life.

editions.flavor: The Sylvok see the artificer as a gardener, preparing the world for hardy growth.

name: Lifespark Spellbomb
text:
{G}, Sacrifice Lifespark Spellbomb: Until end of turn, target land becomes a 3/3 creature that's still a land.
{1}, Sacrifice Lifespark Spellbomb: Draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"Awaken that which was never asleep."
—Spellbomb inscription

name: Lifespinner
text: {T}, Sacrifice three Spirits: Search your library for a legendary Spirit permanent card and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor:
"The husk splits like a madman's smile
And mystery steps forth."
—Snow-Fur, kitsune poet

name: Lifespring Druid
text: {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: "The land is not dead, merely sick. I will nurse it back to health."
